meanings.definition: Canst: archaic second person singular form of 'can'
meanings.sent1: Canst thou see the stars in the sky?
meanings.sent2: I canst hear the birds chirping outside.
meanings.sent3: Even though it is old-fashioned, I canst still understand the meaning.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him canst reach the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: With determination, you canst achieve anything you set your mind to.

meanings.sent1: She canst play the piano beautifully.
meanings.sent3: He canst juggle oranges while riding a unicycle!
meanings.sent4: The wind canst whisper secrets through the trees.
meanings.sent5: With practice, you canst improve your skills over time.

meanings.sent2: I canst run a marathon if I train hard.
meanings.sent3: Even with a broken leg, he canst still hop around.
meanings.sent4: Her smile canst light up even the darkest room.
meanings.sent5: With determination, you canst overcome any obstacle in your path.
